application

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Renderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener

    public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener
    Custom renderer for displaying objects of the type CustomObject to the screen in 3d using OpenGL. Requires OpenGL3 support for VBOS.
    Author:
    Sam Dark

    • Method Summary

      Checks if the camera movement hotkeys are being pressed and updates the camera accordingly limits the camera to 60 updates per second

    • Method Detail

      • getClosing

        public boolean getClosing()
        Returns if the renderer is closing. When the frame is closed this will change to true.
        Returns:
        True or false. False if the renderer is not closing

      • setObjects

        public void setObjects(java.util.ArrayList<CustomObject> inpObjs)
        Sets the objects the renderer is to display to the given objects
        Parameters:
        inpObjs - The objects to display

      • setFrame

        public void setFrame(javax.swing.JFrame inpFrame)
        Sets the frame the canvas is in, used for closing the frame when exit is chosen.
        Parameters:
        inpFrame - The frame the canvas is attached to

      • getCanvas

        public javax.media.opengl.awt.GLCanvas getCanvas()
        Gets the canvas being used for OpenGL
        Returns:
        The GLCanvas being used

      • checkKeys

        public void checkKeys()
        Checks if the camera movement hotkeys are being pressed and updates the camera accordingly limits the camera to 60 updates per second

      • init

        public void init(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Initialises OpenGL settings, lighting and VBOs for use later. Is run once on startup.
        Specified by:
        init in interface javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener

      • setStringForDisplay

        public void setStringForDisplay(java.lang.String inpString)
        Sets an external string to display on the screen. Used for displaying physics update time.
        Parameters:
        inpString - The string to display

      • initTextures

        public java.util.ArrayList<CustomObject> initTextures(java.util.ArrayList<CustomObject> inpObjs)
        Requests that the renderer add textures to the input objects, waits until it is done then returns the objects with textures.
        Parameters:
        inpObjs - The objects to create textures for
        Returns:
        The objects with textures added

      • getObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList<CustomObject> getObjects()
        Gets the objects currently being displayed by the renderer
        Returns:
        The objects in use

      • updateVerticesInScene

        public void updateVerticesInScene()
        Updates the counter that displays the number of vertices in the scene. Call once each time a new object or multiple objects are added. This method is expensive.

      • requestVBOUpdate

        public void requestVBOUpdate()
        Requests that the renderer redo its VBO. Used if the objects materials, textures, vertices (not position/rotation) are changed. Expensive, try not to call this, definitely not once per frame.

      • dispose

        public void dispose(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Disposes all the OpenGL stuff. Called on program exit.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener

      • display

        public void display(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Displays all objects in the scene using the VBO. initVBO() must be called some time previously before this works.
        Specified by:
        display in interface javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener
        Parameters:
        drawable - The drawable to draw to.

      • reshape

        public void reshape(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Reshapes the canvas. Called when the window is resized or resolution changed
        Specified by:
        reshape in interface javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener
